content: @twinsetandpurl ©rachel fletcher 2023 #edwinacowl edwina cowl by twinset & purl pattern information sizes one size yarn walk collection cottage merino 100% sw merino 100g/360m 394 yds the yarn used is slightly heavier than standard fingering however any 4ply/fingering yarn can be used for this pattern needles 3 5mm / us 4 or the size needed to get gauge 56 cm/22-inch needle gauge after blocking 22 sts and 32 rnds = 10 cm/4-inch in lace pattern however gauge is not crucial for this project and you can weigh your yarn as you go to achieve the maximum repeats of the pattern measurements after blocking 68 cm/27 inches circumference by 46 cm/18 inches length notions stitch marker abbreviations k knit m marker p purl pm place marker round s round s sl2 k1 p2sso slip 2 stitches together as if to knit k1 then pass slipped stitches over sm slip marker st s stitch es yo yarn over @twinsetandpurl ©rachel fletcher 2023 #edwinacowl pattern instructions cast on 152 sts with a long tail cast on pm and join for knitting in the round making sure not to twist the sts ribbing section ribbing round 1 k2 p2 repeat to end repeat ribbing round 1 until work measures 2 5 cm/1 inches work 4 rnds in stocking stitch knit every round edwina lace section written instructions round 1 k1 yo × 2 k2 sl2 k1 p2sso k1 repeat to end 152 sts round 2 knit to end round 3 repeat round 1 round 4-8 knit to end note to keep the eyelet design lined up in rnds 1 and 3 except for the first time you work round 1 you will need to move the bor marker forward 1 st before working rnds 1 & 3 only to do this remove the bor marker knit 1 st replace the bor marker and continue with the next round work rnds 1-8 15 times chart instructions chart is worked left to right work 8 st repeat 19 times per round repeat rnds 1-8 15 times note rnds 1* & 3* to keep the eyelet design lined up in rnds 1 and 3 except for the first time you work round 1 you will need to move the bor marker forward 1 st before working rnds 1 & 3 only to do this remove the bor marker knit 1 st replace the bor marker and continue with the next round repeat ribbing section as before cast off loosely in pattern weave
